extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.azure.cosmos.document.PutAzureCosmosDBRecord
extension.description: This processor is a record-aware processor for inserting data into Cosmos DB with Core SQL API. It uses a configured record reader and schema to read an incoming record set from the body of a Flowfile and then inserts those records into a configured Cosmos DB Container.

property.name: azure-cosmos-db-connection-service
property.description: If configured, the controller service used to obtain the connection string and access key

property.name: azure-cosmos-db-uri
property.description: Cosmos DB URI, typically in the form of https://{databaseaccount}.documents.azure.com:443/ Note this host URL is for Cosmos DB with Core SQL API from Azure Portal (Overview->URI)

property.name: azure-cosmos-db-key
property.description: Cosmos DB Access Key from Azure Portal (Settings->Keys). Choose a read-write key to enable database or container creation at run time

property.name: azure-cosmos-db-consistency-level
property.description: Choose from five consistency levels on the consistency spectrum. Refer to Cosmos DB documentation for their differences

property.name: azure-cosmos-db-name
property.description: The database name or id. This is used as the namespace for document collections or containers

property.name: azure-cosmos-db-container-id
property.description: The unique identifier for the container

property.name: azure-cosmos-db-partition-key
property.description: The partition key used to distribute data among servers

property.name: record-reader
property.description: Specifies the Controller Service to use for parsing incoming data and determining the data's schema

property.name: insert-batch-size
property.description: The number of records to group together for one single insert operation against Cosmos DB

property.name: azure-cosmos-db-conflict-handling-strategy
property.description: Choose whether to ignore or upsert when conflict error occurs during insertion

allowableValue.description: Conflicting records will not be inserted, and FlowFile will not be routed to failure
Conflicting records will be upserted, and FlowFile will not be routed to failure

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: All FlowFiles that cannot be written to Cosmos DB are routed to this relationship

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: All FlowFiles that are written to Cosmos DB are routed to this relationship

systemResourceConsideration.description: An instance of this component can cause high usage of this system resource. Multiple instances or high concurrency settings may result a degradation of performance.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.azure.data.explorer.PutAzureDataExplorer
extension.description: Acts as an Azure Data Explorer sink which sends FlowFiles to the provided endpoint. Data can be sent through queued ingestion or streaming ingestion to the Azure Data Explorer cluster.

property.name: Kusto Ingest Service
property.description: Azure Data Explorer Kusto Ingest Service

property.name: Database Name
property.description: Azure Data Explorer Database Name for ingesting data

property.name: Table Name
property.description: Azure Data Explorer Table Name for ingesting data

property.name: Ingest Mapping Name
property.description: The name of the mapping responsible for storing the data in the appropriate columns.

property.name: Data Format
property.description: The format of the data that is sent to Azure Data Explorer. Supported formats include: avro, csv, json

allowableValue.description: An Avro format with support for logical types and for the snappy compression codec
An Avro format with support for logical types and for the snappy compression codec.
A text file with comma-separated values (,). For more information, see RFC 4180: Common Format and MIME Type for Comma-Separated Values (CSV) Files.
A text file containing JSON objects separated by \n or \r\n. For more information, see JSON Lines (JSONL).

A text file containing a JSON array of property containers (each representing a record) or any number of property containers separated by spaces, \n or \r\n. Each property container may be spread across multiple lines. This format is preferable to JSON unless the data is not property containers.
An ORC file.
A parquet file.
A text file with values separated by vertical bars (|).
A text file with values separated by semicolons (;).
A text file with SOH-separated values. (SOH is the ASCII code point 1. This format is used by Hive in HDInsight).
A text file with tab delimited values (\t).
A text file with tab-delimited values (\t). A backslash (\) is used as escape character.
A text file with lines separated by \n. Empty lines are skipped

property.name: Partially Succeeded Routing Strategy
property.description: Defines where to route FlowFiles that resulted in a partially succeeded status.

property.name: Streaming Enabled
property.description: Whether to stream data to Azure Data Explorer.

property.name: Ingestion Ignore First Record
property.description: Defines whether ignore first record while ingestion.

property.name: Poll for Ingest Status
property.description: Determines whether to poll on ingestion status after an ingestion to Azure Data Explorer is completed

property.name: Ingest Status Polling Timeout
property.description: Defines the total amount time to poll for ingestion status

property.name: Ingest Status Polling Interval
property.description: Defines the value of interval of time to poll for ingestion status

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: Ingest processing failed

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: Ingest processing succeeded

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.azure.data.explorer.QueryAzureDataExplorer
extension.description: Query Azure Data Explorer and stream JSON results to output FlowFiles

property.name: Kusto Query Service
property.description: Azure Data Explorer Kusto Query Service

property.name: Database Name
property.description: Azure Data Explorer Database Name for querying

property.name: Query
property.description: Query to be run against Azure Data Explorer

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: FlowFiles containing original input associated with a failed Query

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: FlowFiles containing results of a successful Query

writesAttribute.name: query.error.message
writesAttribute.description: Azure Data Explorer query error message on failures

writesAttribute.name: query.executed
writesAttribute.description: Azure Data Explorer query executed

writesAttribute.name: mime.type
writesAttribute.description: Content Type set to application/json

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.azure.eventhub.ConsumeAzureEventHub
extension.description: Receives messages from Microsoft Azure Event Hubs with checkpointing to ensure consistent event processing. Checkpoint tracking avoids consuming a message multiple times and enables reliable resumption of processing in the event of intermittent network failures. Checkpoint tracking requires external storage and provides the preferred approach to consuming messages from Azure Event Hubs. In clustered environment, ConsumeAzureEventHub processor instances form a consumer group and the messages are distributed among the cluster nodes (each message is processed on one cluster node only).

property.name: event-hub-namespace
property.description: The namespace that the Azure Event Hubs is assigned to. This is generally equal to <Event Hub Names>-ns.

property.name: event-hub-name
property.description: The name of the event hub to pull messages from.

property.name: Service Bus Endpoint
property.description: To support namespaces not in the default windows.net domain.

allowableValue.description: Servicebus endpoint for general use
Servicebus endpoint for China
Servicebus endpoint for Germany
Servicebus endpoint for US Government

property.name: Transport Type
property.description: Advanced Message Queuing Protocol Transport Type for communication with Azure Event Hubs

allowableValue.description: AMQP over TCP on ports 5671 and 5672
AMQP over HTTPS with WebSockets on port 443

property.name: event-hub-shared-access-policy-name
property.description: The name of the shared access policy. This policy must have Listen claims.

property.name: event-hub-shared-access-policy-primary-key
property.description: The key of the shared access policy. Either the primary or the secondary key can be used.

property.name: use-managed-identity
property.description: Choose whether or not to use the managed identity of Azure VM/VMSS

property.name: event-hub-consumer-group
property.description: The name of the consumer group to use.

property.name: record-reader
property.description: The Record Reader to use for reading received messages. The event hub name can be referred by Expression Language '${eventhub.name}' to access a schema.

property.name: record-writer
property.description: The Record Writer to use for serializing Records to an output FlowFile. The event hub name can be referred by Expression Language '${eventhub.name}' to access a schema. If not specified, each message will create a FlowFile.

property.name: event-hub-initial-offset
property.description: Specify where to start receiving messages if offset is not yet stored in the checkpoint store.

allowableValue.description: Read from the oldest message retained in the stream.
Ignore old retained messages even if exist, start reading new ones from now.

property.name: event-hub-batch-size
property.description: The number of messages to process within a NiFi session. This parameter affects throughput and consistency. NiFi commits its session and Event Hubs checkpoints after processing this number of messages. If NiFi session is committed, but fails to create an Event Hubs checkpoint, then it is possible that the same messages will be received again. The higher number, the higher throughput, but possibly less consistent.

property.name: event-hub-message-receive-timeout
property.description: The amount of time this consumer should wait to receive the Batch Size before returning.

property.name: checkpoint-strategy
property.description: Specifies which strategy to use for storing and retrieving partition ownership and checkpoint information for each partition.

allowableValue.description: Use Azure Blob Storage to store partition ownership and checkpoint information
Use component state to store partition ownership and checkpoint information

property.name: storage-account-name
property.description: Name of the Azure Storage account to store event hub consumer group state.

property.name: storage-account-key
property.description: The Azure Storage account key to store event hub consumer group state.

property.name: storage-sas-token
property.description: The Azure Storage SAS token to store Event Hub consumer group state. Always starts with a ? character.

property.name: storage-container-name
property.description: Name of the Azure Storage container to store the event hub consumer group state. If not specified, event hub name is used.

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. Supported proxies: HTTP + AuthN

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: FlowFiles received from Event Hub.

writesAttribute.name: eventhub.enqueued.timestamp
writesAttribute.description: The time (in milliseconds since epoch, UTC) at which the message was enqueued in the event hub

writesAttribute.name: eventhub.offset
writesAttribute.description: The offset into the partition at which the message was stored

writesAttribute.name: eventhub.sequence
writesAttribute.description: The sequence number associated with the message

writesAttribute.name: eventhub.name
writesAttribute.description: The name of the event hub from which the message was pulled

writesAttribute.name: eventhub.partition
writesAttribute.description: The name of the partition from which the message was pulled

writesAttribute.name: eventhub.property.*
writesAttribute.description: The application properties of this message. IE: 'application' would be 'eventhub.property.application'

stateful.description: Local state is used to store the client id. Cluster state is used to store partition ownership and checkpoint information when component state is configured as the checkpointing strategy.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.azure.eventhub.GetAzureEventHub
extension.description: Receives messages from Microsoft Azure Event Hubs without reliable checkpoint tracking. In clustered environment, GetAzureEventHub processor instances work independently and all cluster nodes process all messages (unless running the processor in Primary Only mode). ConsumeAzureEventHub offers the recommended approach to receiving messages from Azure Event Hubs. This processor creates a thread pool for connections to Azure Event Hubs.

property.name: Event Hub Namespace
property.description: Namespace of Azure Event Hubs prefixed to Service Bus Endpoint domain

property.name: Event Hub Name
property.description: Name of Azure Event Hubs source

property.name: Service Bus Endpoint
property.description: To support namespaces not in the default windows.net domain.

allowableValue.description: Servicebus endpoint for general use
Servicebus endpoint for China
Servicebus endpoint for Germany
Servicebus endpoint for US Government

property.name: Transport Type
property.description: Advanced Message Queuing Protocol Transport Type for communication with Azure Event Hubs

allowableValue.description: AMQP over TCP on ports 5671 and 5672
AMQP over HTTPS with WebSockets on port 443

property.name: Shared Access Policy Name
property.description: The name of the shared access policy. This policy must have Listen claims.

property.name: Shared Access Policy Primary Key
property.description: The key of the shared access policy. Either the primary or the secondary key can be used.

property.name: use-managed-identity
property.description: Choose whether or not to use the managed identity of Azure VM/VMSS

property.name: Event Hub Consumer Group
property.description: The name of the consumer group to use when pulling events

property.name: Event Hub Message Enqueue Time
property.description: A timestamp (ISO-8601 Instant) formatted as YYYY-MM-DDThhmmss.sssZ (2016-01-01T01:01:01.000Z) from which messages should have been enqueued in the Event Hub to start reading from

property.name: Partition Recivier Fetch Size
property.description: The number of events that a receiver should fetch from an Event Hubs partition before returning. The default is 100

property.name: Partition Receiver Timeout (millseconds)
property.description: The amount of time in milliseconds a Partition Receiver should wait to receive the Fetch Size before returning. The default is 60000

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. Supported proxies: HTTP + AuthN

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: Any FlowFile that is successfully received from the event hub will be transferred to this Relationship.

writesAttribute.name: eventhub.enqueued.timestamp
writesAttribute.description: The time (in milliseconds since epoch, UTC) at which the message was enqueued in the event hub

writesAttribute.name: eventhub.offset
writesAttribute.description: The offset into the partition at which the message was stored

writesAttribute.name: eventhub.sequence
writesAttribute.description: The Azure sequence number associated with the message

writesAttribute.name: eventhub.name
writesAttribute.description: The name of the event hub from which the message was pulled

writesAttribute.name: eventhub.partition
writesAttribute.description: The name of the event hub partition from which the message was pulled

writesAttribute.name: eventhub.property.*
writesAttribute.description: The application properties of this message. IE: 'application' would be 'eventhub.property.application'

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.azure.eventhub.PutAzureEventHub
extension.description: Send FlowFile contents to Azure Event Hubs

property.name: Event Hub Namespace
property.description: Namespace of Azure Event Hubs prefixed to Service Bus Endpoint domain

property.name: Event Hub Name
property.description: Name of Azure Event Hubs destination

property.name: Service Bus Endpoint
property.description: To support namespaces not in the default windows.net domain.

allowableValue.description: Servicebus endpoint for general use
Servicebus endpoint for China
Servicebus endpoint for Germany
Servicebus endpoint for US Government

property.name: Transport Type
property.description: Advanced Message Queuing Protocol Transport Type for communication with Azure Event Hubs

allowableValue.description: AMQP over TCP on ports 5671 and 5672
AMQP over HTTPS with WebSockets on port 443

property.name: Shared Access Policy Name
property.description: The name of the shared access policy. This policy must have Send claims.

property.name: Shared Access Policy Primary Key
property.description: The key of the shared access policy. Either the primary or the secondary key can be used.

property.name: use-managed-identity
property.description: Choose whether or not to use the managed identity of Azure VM/VMSS

property.name: partitioning-key-attribute-name
property.description: If specified, the value from argument named by this field will be used as a partitioning key to be used by event hub.

property.name: max-batch-size
property.description: Maximum number of FlowFiles processed for each Processor invocation

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. Supported proxies: HTTP + AuthN

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: Any FlowFile that could not be sent to the event hub will be transferred to this Relationship.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: Any FlowFile that is successfully sent to the event hubs will be transferred to this Relationship.

systemResourceConsideration.description: The Processor buffers FlowFile contents in memory before sending

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.azure.storage.CopyAzureBlobStorage_v12
extension.description: Copies a blob in Azure Blob Storage from one account/container to another. The processor uses Azure Blob Storage client library v12.

property.name: Source Storage Credentials
property.description: Credentials Service used to obtain Azure Blob Storage Credentials to read Source Blob information

property.name: Source Container Name
property.description: Name of the Azure storage container that will be copied

property.name: Source Blob Name
property.description: The full name of the source blob

property.name: storage-credentials-service
property.description: Controller Service used to obtain Azure Blob Storage Credentials.

property.name: container-name
property.description: Name of the Azure storage container destination defaults to the Source Container Name when not specified

property.name: blob-name
property.description: The full name of the destination blob defaults to the Source Blob Name when not specified

property.name: conflict-resolution-strategy
property.description: Specifies whether an existing blob will have its contents replaced upon conflict.

allowableValue.description: Fail if the blob already exists
Ignore if the blob already exists; the 'azure.error' attribute will be set to the value 'BLOB_ALREADY_EXISTS'
Replace blob contents if the blob already exist

property.name: create-container
property.description: Specifies whether to check if the container exists and to automatically create it if it does not. Permission to list containers is required. If false, this check is not made, but the Put operation will fail if the container does not exist.

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. Supported proxies: SOCKS, HTTP In case of SOCKS, it is not guaranteed that the selected SOCKS Version will be used by the processor.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: Unsuccessful operations will be transferred to the failure relationship.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: All successfully processed FlowFiles are routed to this relationship

writesAttribute.name: azure.container
writesAttribute.description: The name of the Azure Blob Storage container

writesAttribute.name: azure.blobname
writesAttribute.description: The name of the blob on Azure Blob Storage

writesAttribute.name: azure.primaryUri
writesAttribute.description: Primary location of the blob

writesAttribute.name: azure.etag
writesAttribute.description: ETag of the blob

writesAttribute.name: azure.blobtype
writesAttribute.description: Type of the blob (either BlockBlob, PageBlob or AppendBlob)

writesAttribute.name: mime.type
writesAttribute.description: MIME Type of the content

writesAttribute.name: lang
writesAttribute.description: Language code for the content

writesAttribute.name: azure.timestamp
writesAttribute.description: Timestamp of the blob

writesAttribute.name: azure.length
writesAttribute.description: Length of the blob

writesAttribute.name: azure.error.code
writesAttribute.description: Error code reported during blob operation

writesAttribute.name: azure.ignored
writesAttribute.description: When Conflict Resolution Strategy is 'ignore', this property will be true/false depending on whether the blob was ignored.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.azure.storage.DeleteAzureBlobStorage_v12
extension.description: Deletes the specified blob from Azure Blob Storage. The processor uses Azure Blob Storage client library v12.

property.name: storage-credentials-service
property.description: Controller Service used to obtain Azure Blob Storage Credentials.

property.name: container-name
property.description: Name of the Azure storage container. In case of PutAzureBlobStorage processor, container can be created if it does not exist.

property.name: blob-name
property.description: The full name of the blob

property.name: delete-snapshots-option
property.description: Specifies the snapshot deletion options to be used when deleting a blob.

allowableValue.description: Delete the blob only.
Delete the blob and its snapshots.
Delete only the blob's snapshots.

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. Supported proxies: SOCKS, HTTP In case of SOCKS, it is not guaranteed that the selected SOCKS Version will be used by the processor.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: Unsuccessful operations will be transferred to the failure relationship.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: All successfully processed FlowFiles are routed to this relationship

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.azure.storage.DeleteAzureDataLakeStorage
extension.description: Deletes the provided file from Azure Data Lake Storage

property.name: adls-credentials-service
property.description: Controller Service used to obtain Azure Credentials.

property.name: filesystem-name
property.description: Name of the Azure Storage File System (also called Container). It is assumed to be already existing.

property.name: filesystem-object-type
property.description: They type of the file system object to be deleted. It can be either folder or file.

allowableValue.description: The object to be deleted is a file.
The object to be deleted is a directory.

property.name: directory-name
property.description: Name of the Azure Storage Directory. The Directory Name cannot contain a leading '/'. The root directory can be designated by the empty string value. In case of the PutAzureDataLakeStorage processor, the directory will be created if not already existing.

property.name: file-name
property.description: The filename

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. Supported proxies: SOCKS, HTTP In case of SOCKS, it is not guaranteed that the selected SOCKS Version will be used by the processor.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: Files that could not be written to Azure storage for some reason are transferred to this relationship

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: Files that have been successfully written to Azure storage are transferred to this relationship

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.azure.storage.FetchAzureBlobStorage_v12
extension.description: Retrieves the specified blob from Azure Blob Storage and writes its content to the content of the FlowFile. The processor uses Azure Blob Storage client library v12.

property.name: storage-credentials-service
property.description: Controller Service used to obtain Azure Blob Storage Credentials.

property.name: container-name
property.description: Name of the Azure storage container. In case of PutAzureBlobStorage processor, container can be created if it does not exist.

property.name: blob-name
property.description: The full name of the blob

property.name: range-start
property.description: The byte position at which to start reading from the blob. An empty value or a value of zero will start reading at the beginning of the blob.

property.name: range-length
property.description: The number of bytes to download from the blob, starting from the Range Start. An empty value or a value that extends beyond the end of the blob will read to the end of the blob.

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. Supported proxies: SOCKS, HTTP In case of SOCKS, it is not guaranteed that the selected SOCKS Version will be used by the processor.

property.name: Client-Side Encryption Key Type
property.description: Specifies the key type to use for client-side encryption.

allowableValue.description: Client-Side Encryption disabled
Client-Side Encryption enabled using local key

property.name: Client-Side Encryption Key ID
property.description: Specifies the ID of the key to use for client-side encryption.

property.name: Client-Side Encryption Local Key
property.description: When using local client-side encryption, this is the raw key, encoded in hexadecimal

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: Unsuccessful operations will be transferred to the failure relationship.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: All successfully processed FlowFiles are routed to this relationship

writesAttribute.name: azure.container
writesAttribute.description: The name of the Azure Blob Storage container

writesAttribute.name: azure.blobname
writesAttribute.description: The name of the blob on Azure Blob Storage

writesAttribute.name: azure.primaryUri
writesAttribute.description: Primary location of the blob

writesAttribute.name: azure.etag
writesAttribute.description: ETag of the blob

writesAttribute.name: azure.blobtype
writesAttribute.description: Type of the blob (either BlockBlob, PageBlob or AppendBlob)

writesAttribute.name: mime.type
writesAttribute.description: MIME Type of the content

writesAttribute.name: lang
writesAttribute.description: Language code for the content

writesAttribute.name: azure.timestamp
writesAttribute.description: Timestamp of the blob

writesAttribute.name: azure.length
writesAttribute.description: Length of the blob

multiProcessorUseCase.description: Retrieve all files in an Azure Blob Storage container

processorConfiguration.configuration:
The "Container Name" property should be set to the name of the Blob Storage Container that files reside in. If the flow being built is to be reused elsewhere, it's a good idea to parameterize this property by setting it to something like `#{AZURE_CONTAINER}`.
The "Storage Credentials" property should specify an instance of the AzureStorageCredentialsService_v12 in order to provide credentials for accessing the storage container.
The 'success' Relationship of this Processor is then connected to FetchAzureBlobStorage_v12.

"Container Name" = "${azure.container}" "Blob Name" = "${azure.blobname}"
The "Storage Credentials" property should specify an instance of the AzureStorageCredentialsService_v12 in order to provide credentials for accessing the storage container.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.azure.storage.FetchAzureDataLakeStorage
extension.description: Fetch the specified file from Azure Data Lake Storage

property.name: adls-credentials-service
property.description: Controller Service used to obtain Azure Credentials.

property.name: filesystem-name
property.description: Name of the Azure Storage File System (also called Container). It is assumed to be already existing.

property.name: directory-name
property.description: Name of the Azure Storage Directory. The Directory Name cannot contain a leading '/'. The root directory can be designated by the empty string value. In case of the PutAzureDataLakeStorage processor, the directory will be created if not already existing.

property.name: file-name
property.description: The filename

property.name: range-start
property.description: The byte position at which to start reading from the object. An empty value or a value of zero will start reading at the beginning of the object.

property.name: range-length
property.description: The number of bytes to download from the object, starting from the Range Start. An empty value or a value that extends beyond the end of the object will read to the end of the object.

property.name: number-of-retries
property.description: The number of automatic retries to perform if the download fails.

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. Supported proxies: SOCKS, HTTP In case of SOCKS, it is not guaranteed that the selected SOCKS Version will be used by the processor.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: Files that could not be written to Azure storage for some reason are transferred to this relationship

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: Files that have been successfully written to Azure storage are transferred to this relationship

writesAttribute.name: azure.datalake.storage.statusCode
writesAttribute.description: The HTTP error code (if available) from the failed operation

writesAttribute.name: azure.datalake.storage.errorCode
writesAttribute.description: The Azure Data Lake Storage moniker of the failed operation

writesAttribute.name: azure.datalake.storage.errorMessage
writesAttribute.description: The Azure Data Lake Storage error message from the failed operation

multiProcessorUseCase.description: Retrieve all files in an Azure DataLake Storage directory

processorConfiguration.configuration:
The "Filesystem Name" property should be set to the name of the Azure Filesystem (also known as a Container) that files reside in. If the flow being built is to be reused elsewhere, it's a good idea to parameterize this property by setting it to something like `#{AZURE_FILESYSTEM}`. Configure the "Directory Name" property to specify the name of the directory in the file system. If the flow being built is to be reused elsewhere, it's a good idea to parameterize this property by setting it to something like `#{AZURE_DIRECTORY}`.
The "ADLS Credentials" property should specify an instance of the ADLSCredentialsService in order to provide credentials for accessing the filesystem.
The 'success' Relationship of this Processor is then connected to FetchAzureDataLakeStorage.

"Filesystem Name" = "${azure.filesystem}" "Directory Name" = "${azure.directory}" "File Name" = "${azure.filename}"
The "ADLS Credentials" property should specify an instance of the ADLSCredentialsService in order to provide credentials for accessing the filesystem.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.azure.storage.ListAzureBlobStorage_v12
extension.description: Lists blobs in an Azure Blob Storage container. Listing details are attached to an empty FlowFile for use with FetchAzureBlobStorage. This Processor is designed to run on Primary Node only in a cluster. If the primary node changes, the new Primary Node will pick up where the previous node left off without duplicating all of the data. The processor uses Azure Blob Storage client library v12.

property.name: storage-credentials-service
property.description: Controller Service used to obtain Azure Blob Storage Credentials.

property.name: container-name
property.description: Name of the Azure storage container. In case of PutAzureBlobStorage processor, container can be created if it does not exist.

property.name: blob-name-prefix
property.description: Search prefix for listing

property.name: record-writer
property.description: Specifies the Record Writer to use for creating the listing. If not specified, one FlowFile will be created for each entity that is listed. If the Record Writer is specified, all entities will be written to a single FlowFile instead of adding attributes to individual FlowFiles.

property.name: listing-strategy
property.description: Specify how to determine new/updated entities. See each strategy descriptions for detail.

allowableValue.description: This strategy tracks the latest timestamp of listed entity to determine new/updated entities. Since it only tracks few timestamps, it can manage listing state efficiently. However, any newly added, or updated entity having timestamp older than the tracked latest timestamp can not be picked by this strategy. For example, such situation can happen in a file system if a file with old timestamp is copied or moved into the target directory without its last modified timestamp being updated. Also may miss files when multiple subdirectories are being written at the same time while listing is running.

This strategy tracks information of all the listed entities within the latest 'Entity Tracking Time Window' to determine new/updated entities. This strategy can pick entities having old timestamp that can be missed with 'Tracking Timestamps'. Works even when multiple subdirectories are being written at the same time while listing is running. However additional DistributedMapCache controller service is required and more JVM heap memory is used. See the description of 'Entity Tracking Time Window' property for further details on how it works.

This strategy lists an entity without any tracking. The same entity will be listed each time on executing this processor. It is recommended to change the default run schedule value. Any property that related to the persisting state will be disregarded.

property.name: et-state-cache
property.description: Listed entities are stored in the specified cache storage so that this processor can resume listing across NiFi restart or in case of primary node change. 'Tracking Entities' strategy require tracking information of all listed entities within the last 'Tracking Time Window'. To support large number of entities, the strategy uses DistributedMapCache instead of managed state. Cache key format is 'ListedEntities::{processorId}(::{nodeId})'. If it tracks per node listed entities, then the optional '::{nodeId}' part is added to manage state separately. E.g. cluster wide cache key = 'ListedEntities::8dda2321-0164-1000-50fa-3042fe7d6a7b', per node cache key = 'ListedEntities::8dda2321-0164-1000-50fa-3042fe7d6a7b::nifi-node3' The stored cache content is Gzipped JSON string. The cache key will be deleted when target listing configuration is changed. Used by 'Tracking Entities' strategy.

property.name: et-time-window
property.description: Specify how long this processor should track already-listed entities. 'Tracking Entities' strategy can pick any entity whose timestamp is inside the specified time window. For example, if set to '30 minutes', any entity having timestamp in recent 30 minutes will be the listing target when this processor runs. A listed entity is considered 'new/updated' and a FlowFile is emitted if one of following condition meets: 1. does not exist in the already-listed entities, 2. has newer timestamp than the cached entity, 3. has different size than the cached entity. If a cached entity's timestamp becomes older than specified time window, that entity will be removed from the cached already-listed entities. Used by 'Tracking Entities' strategy.

property.name: et-initial-listing-target
property.description: Specify how initial listing should be handled. Used by 'Tracking Entities' strategy.

allowableValue.description: Ignore entities having timestamp older than the specified 'Tracking Time Window' at the initial listing activity.
Regardless of entities timestamp, all existing entities will be listed at the initial listing activity.

property.name: Minimum File Age
property.description: The minimum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file younger than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored

property.name: Maximum File Age
property.description: The maximum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file older than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored

property.name: Minimum File Size
property.description: The minimum size that a file must be in order to be pulled

property.name: Maximum File Size
property.description: The maximum size that a file can be in order to be pulled

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. Supported proxies: SOCKS, HTTP In case of SOCKS, it is not guaranteed that the selected SOCKS Version will be used by the processor.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: All FlowFiles that are received are routed to success

writesAttribute.name: azure.container
writesAttribute.description: The name of the Azure Blob Storage container

writesAttribute.name: azure.blobname
writesAttribute.description: The name of the blob on Azure Blob Storage

writesAttribute.name: azure.primaryUri
writesAttribute.description: Primary location of the blob

writesAttribute.name: azure.etag
writesAttribute.description: ETag of the blob

writesAttribute.name: azure.blobtype
writesAttribute.description: Type of the blob (either BlockBlob, PageBlob or AppendBlob)

writesAttribute.name: mime.type
writesAttribute.description: MIME Type of the content

writesAttribute.name: lang
writesAttribute.description: Language code for the content

writesAttribute.name: azure.timestamp
writesAttribute.description: Timestamp of the blob

writesAttribute.name: azure.length
writesAttribute.description: Length of the blob

stateful.description: After performing a listing of blobs, the timestamp of the newest blob is stored if 'Tracking Timestamps' Listing Strategy is in use (by default). This allows the Processor to list only blobs that have been added or modified after this date the next time that the Processor is run. State is stored across the cluster so that this Processor can be run on Primary Node only and if a new Primary Node is selected, the new node can pick up where the previous node left off, without duplicating the data.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.azure.storage.ListAzureDataLakeStorage
extension.description: Lists directory in an Azure Data Lake Storage Gen 2 filesystem

property.name: adls-credentials-service
property.description: Controller Service used to obtain Azure Credentials.

property.name: filesystem-name
property.description: Name of the Azure Storage File System (also called Container). It is assumed to be already existing.

property.name: directory-name
property.description: Name of the Azure Storage Directory. The Directory Name cannot contain a leading '/'. The root directory can be designated by the empty string value. In case of the PutAzureDataLakeStorage processor, the directory will be created if not already existing.

property.name: recurse-subdirectories
property.description: Indicates whether to list files from subdirectories of the directory

property.name: file-filter
property.description: Only files whose names match the given regular expression will be listed

property.name: path-filter
property.description: When 'Recurse Subdirectories' is true, then only subdirectories whose paths match the given regular expression will be scanned

property.name: include-temporary-files
property.description: Whether to include temporary files when listing the contents of configured directory paths.

property.name: record-writer
property.description: Specifies the Record Writer to use for creating the listing. If not specified, one FlowFile will be created for each entity that is listed. If the Record Writer is specified, all entities will be written to a single FlowFile instead of adding attributes to individual FlowFiles.

property.name: listing-strategy
property.description: Specify how to determine new/updated entities. See each strategy descriptions for detail.

allowableValue.description: This strategy tracks the latest timestamp of listed entity to determine new/updated entities. Since it only tracks few timestamps, it can manage listing state efficiently. However, any newly added, or updated entity having timestamp older than the tracked latest timestamp can not be picked by this strategy. For example, such situation can happen in a file system if a file with old timestamp is copied or moved into the target directory without its last modified timestamp being updated. Also may miss files when multiple subdirectories are being written at the same time while listing is running.

This strategy tracks information of all the listed entities within the latest 'Entity Tracking Time Window' to determine new/updated entities. This strategy can pick entities having old timestamp that can be missed with 'Tracking Timestamps'. Works even when multiple subdirectories are being written at the same time while listing is running. However additional DistributedMapCache controller service is required and more JVM heap memory is used. See the description of 'Entity Tracking Time Window' property for further details on how it works.

This strategy lists an entity without any tracking. The same entity will be listed each time on executing this processor. It is recommended to change the default run schedule value. Any property that related to the persisting state will be disregarded.

property.name: et-state-cache
property.description: Listed entities are stored in the specified cache storage so that this processor can resume listing across NiFi restart or in case of primary node change. 'Tracking Entities' strategy require tracking information of all listed entities within the last 'Tracking Time Window'. To support large number of entities, the strategy uses DistributedMapCache instead of managed state. Cache key format is 'ListedEntities::{processorId}(::{nodeId})'. If it tracks per node listed entities, then the optional '::{nodeId}' part is added to manage state separately. E.g. cluster wide cache key = 'ListedEntities::8dda2321-0164-1000-50fa-3042fe7d6a7b', per node cache key = 'ListedEntities::8dda2321-0164-1000-50fa-3042fe7d6a7b::nifi-node3' The stored cache content is Gzipped JSON string. The cache key will be deleted when target listing configuration is changed. Used by 'Tracking Entities' strategy.

property.name: et-time-window
property.description: Specify how long this processor should track already-listed entities. 'Tracking Entities' strategy can pick any entity whose timestamp is inside the specified time window. For example, if set to '30 minutes', any entity having timestamp in recent 30 minutes will be the listing target when this processor runs. A listed entity is considered 'new/updated' and a FlowFile is emitted if one of following condition meets: 1. does not exist in the already-listed entities, 2. has newer timestamp than the cached entity, 3. has different size than the cached entity. If a cached entity's timestamp becomes older than specified time window, that entity will be removed from the cached already-listed entities. Used by 'Tracking Entities' strategy.

property.name: et-initial-listing-target
property.description: Specify how initial listing should be handled. Used by 'Tracking Entities' strategy.

allowableValue.description: Ignore entities having timestamp older than the specified 'Tracking Time Window' at the initial listing activity.
Regardless of entities timestamp, all existing entities will be listed at the initial listing activity.

property.name: Minimum File Age
property.description: The minimum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file younger than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored

property.name: Maximum File Age
property.description: The maximum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file older than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored

property.name: Minimum File Size
property.description: The minimum size that a file must be in order to be pulled

property.name: Maximum File Size
property.description: The maximum size that a file can be in order to be pulled

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. Supported proxies: SOCKS, HTTP In case of SOCKS, it is not guaranteed that the selected SOCKS Version will be used by the processor.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: All FlowFiles that are received are routed to success

writesAttribute.name: azure.filesystem
writesAttribute.description: The name of the Azure File System

writesAttribute.name: azure.filePath
writesAttribute.description: The full path of the Azure File

writesAttribute.name: azure.directory
writesAttribute.description: The name of the Azure Directory

writesAttribute.name: azure.filename
writesAttribute.description: The name of the Azure File

writesAttribute.name: azure.length
writesAttribute.description: The length of the Azure File

writesAttribute.name: azure.lastModified
writesAttribute.description: The last modification time of the Azure File

writesAttribute.name: azure.etag
writesAttribute.description: The ETag of the Azure File

stateful.description: After performing a listing of files, the timestamp of the newest file is stored. This allows the Processor to list only files that have been added or modified after this date the next time that the Processor is run. State is stored across the cluster so that this Processor can be run on Primary Node only and if a new Primary Node is selected, the new node can pick up where the previous node left off, without duplicating the data.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.azure.storage.MoveAzureDataLakeStorage
extension.description: Moves content within an Azure Data Lake Storage Gen 2. After the move, files will be no longer available on source location.

property.name: adls-credentials-service
property.description: Controller Service used to obtain Azure Credentials.

property.name: source-filesystem-name
property.description: Name of the Azure Storage File System from where the move should happen.

property.name: source-directory-name
property.description: Name of the Azure Storage Directory from where the move should happen. The Directory Name cannot contain a leading '/'. The root directory can be designated by the empty string value.

property.name: filesystem-name
property.description: Name of the Azure Storage File System where the files will be moved.

property.name: directory-name
property.description: Name of the Azure Storage Directory where the files will be moved. The Directory Name cannot contain a leading '/'. The root directory can be designated by the empty string value. Non-existing directories will be created. If the original directory structure should be kept, the full directory path needs to be provided after the destination directory. e.g.: destdir/${azure.directory}

property.name: file-name
property.description: The filename

property.name: conflict-resolution-strategy
property.description: Indicates what should happen when a file with the same name already exists in the output directory

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. Supported proxies: SOCKS, HTTP In case of SOCKS, it is not guaranteed that the selected SOCKS Version will be used by the processor.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: Files that could not be written to Azure storage for some reason are transferred to this relationship

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: Files that have been successfully written to Azure storage are transferred to this relationship

writesAttribute.name: azure.source.filesystem
writesAttribute.description: The name of the source Azure File System

writesAttribute.name: azure.source.directory
writesAttribute.description: The name of the source Azure Directory

writesAttribute.name: azure.filesystem
writesAttribute.description: The name of the Azure File System

writesAttribute.name: azure.directory
writesAttribute.description: The name of the Azure Directory

writesAttribute.name: azure.filename
writesAttribute.description: The name of the Azure File

writesAttribute.name: azure.primaryUri
writesAttribute.description: Primary location for file content

writesAttribute.name: azure.length
writesAttribute.description: The length of the Azure File

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.azure.storage.PutAzureBlobStorage_v12
extension.description: Puts content into a blob on Azure Blob Storage. The processor uses Azure Blob Storage client library v12.

property.name: storage-credentials-service
property.description: Controller Service used to obtain Azure Blob Storage Credentials.

property.name: container-name
property.description: Name of the Azure storage container. In case of PutAzureBlobStorage processor, container can be created if it does not exist.

property.name: create-container
property.description: Specifies whether to check if the container exists and to automatically create it if it does not. Permission to list containers is required. If false, this check is not made, but the Put operation will fail if the container does not exist.

property.name: conflict-resolution-strategy
property.description: Specifies whether an existing blob will have its contents replaced upon conflict.

allowableValue.description: Fail if the blob already exists
Ignore if the blob already exists; the 'azure.error' attribute will be set to the value 'BLOB_ALREADY_EXISTS'
Replace blob contents if the blob already exist

property.name: blob-name
property.description: The full name of the blob

property.name: Resource Transfer Source
property.description: The source of the content to be transferred

allowableValue.description: The content of the incoming FlowFile provides the source for transfer
The File Resource Service provides the source for transfer

property.name: File Resource Service
property.description: File Resource Service providing access to the local resource to be transferred

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. Supported proxies: SOCKS, HTTP In case of SOCKS, it is not guaranteed that the selected SOCKS Version will be used by the processor.

property.name: Client-Side Encryption Key Type
property.description: Specifies the key type to use for client-side encryption.

allowableValue.description: Client-Side Encryption disabled
Client-Side Encryption enabled using local key

property.name: Client-Side Encryption Key ID
property.description: Specifies the ID of the key to use for client-side encryption.

property.name: Client-Side Encryption Local Key
property.description: When using local client-side encryption, this is the raw key, encoded in hexadecimal

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: Unsuccessful operations will be transferred to the failure relationship.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: All successfully processed FlowFiles are routed to this relationship

writesAttribute.name: azure.container
writesAttribute.description: The name of the Azure Blob Storage container

writesAttribute.name: azure.blobname
writesAttribute.description: The name of the blob on Azure Blob Storage

writesAttribute.name: azure.primaryUri
writesAttribute.description: Primary location of the blob

writesAttribute.name: azure.etag
writesAttribute.description: ETag of the blob

writesAttribute.name: azure.blobtype
writesAttribute.description: Type of the blob (either BlockBlob, PageBlob or AppendBlob)

writesAttribute.name: mime.type
writesAttribute.description: MIME Type of the content

writesAttribute.name: lang
writesAttribute.description: Language code for the content

writesAttribute.name: azure.timestamp
writesAttribute.description: Timestamp of the blob

writesAttribute.name: azure.length
writesAttribute.description: Length of the blob

writesAttribute.name: azure.error.code
writesAttribute.description: Error code reported during blob operation

writesAttribute.name: azure.ignored
writesAttribute.description: When Conflict Resolution Strategy is 'ignore', this property will be true/false depending on whether the blob was ignored.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.azure.storage.PutAzureDataLakeStorage
extension.description: Writes the contents of a FlowFile as a file on Azure Data Lake Storage Gen 2

property.name: adls-credentials-service
property.description: Controller Service used to obtain Azure Credentials.

property.name: filesystem-name
property.description: Name of the Azure Storage File System (also called Container). It is assumed to be already existing.

property.name: directory-name
property.description: Name of the Azure Storage Directory. The Directory Name cannot contain a leading '/'. The root directory can be designated by the empty string value. In case of the PutAzureDataLakeStorage processor, the directory will be created if not already existing.

property.name: file-name
property.description: The filename

property.name: writing-strategy
property.description: Defines the approach for writing the Azure file.

allowableValue.description: The processor writes the Azure file into a temporary directory and then renames/moves it to the final destination. This prevents other processes from reading partially written files.
The processor writes the Azure file directly to the destination. This might result in the reading of partially written files.

property.name: base-temporary-path
property.description: The Path where the temporary directory will be created. The Path name cannot contain a leading '/'. The root directory can be designated by the empty string value. Non-existing directories will be created.The Temporary File Directory name is _nifitempdirectory

property.name: conflict-resolution-strategy
property.description: Indicates what should happen when a file with the same name already exists in the output directory

property.name: Resource Transfer Source
property.description: The source of the content to be transferred

allowableValue.description: The content of the incoming FlowFile provides the source for transfer
The File Resource Service provides the source for transfer

property.name: File Resource Service
property.description: File Resource Service providing access to the local resource to be transferred

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. Supported proxies: SOCKS, HTTP In case of SOCKS, it is not guaranteed that the selected SOCKS Version will be used by the processor.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: Files that could not be written to Azure storage for some reason are transferred to this relationship

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: Files that have been successfully written to Azure storage are transferred to this relationship

writesAttribute.name: azure.filesystem
writesAttribute.description: The name of the Azure File System

writesAttribute.name: azure.directory
writesAttribute.description: The name of the Azure Directory

writesAttribute.name: azure.filename
writesAttribute.description: The name of the Azure File

writesAttribute.name: azure.primaryUri
writesAttribute.description: Primary location for file content

writesAttribute.name: azure.length
writesAttribute.description: The length of the Azure File

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.azure.storage.queue.GetAzureQueueStorage_v12
extension.description: Retrieves the messages from an Azure Queue Storage. The retrieved messages will be deleted from the queue by default. If the requirement is to consume messages without deleting them, set 'Auto Delete Messages' to 'false'. Note: There might be chances of receiving duplicates in situations like when a message is received but was unable to be deleted from the queue due to some unexpected situations.

property.name: Queue Name
property.description: Name of the Azure Storage Queue

property.name: storage-endpoint-suffix
property.description: Storage accounts in public Azure always use a common FQDN suffix. Override this endpoint suffix with a different suffix in certain circumstances (like Azure Stack or non-public Azure regions).

property.name: Credentials Service
property.description: Controller Service used to obtain Azure Storage Credentials.

property.name: Auto Delete Messages
property.description: Specifies whether the received message is to be automatically deleted from the queue.

property.name: Message Batch Size
property.description: The number of messages to be retrieved from the queue.

property.name: Visibility Timeout
property.description: The duration during which the retrieved message should be invisible to other consumers.

property.name: Request Timeout
property.description: The timeout for read or write requests to Azure Queue Storage. Defaults to 1 second.

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. Supported proxies: SOCKS, HTTP In case of SOCKS, it is not guaranteed that the selected SOCKS Version will be used by the processor.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: All successfully processed FlowFiles are routed to this relationship

writesAttribute.name: azure.queue.uri
writesAttribute.description: The absolute URI of the configured Azure Queue Storage

writesAttribute.name: azure.queue.insertionTime
writesAttribute.description: The time when the message was inserted into the queue storage

writesAttribute.name: azure.queue.expirationTime
writesAttribute.description: The time when the message will expire from the queue storage

writesAttribute.name: azure.queue.messageId
writesAttribute.description: The ID of the retrieved message

writesAttribute.name: azure.queue.popReceipt
writesAttribute.description: The pop receipt of the retrieved message

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.azure.storage.queue.PutAzureQueueStorage_v12
extension.description: Writes the content of the incoming FlowFiles to the configured Azure Queue Storage.

property.name: Queue Name
property.description: Name of the Azure Storage Queue

property.name: storage-endpoint-suffix
property.description: Storage accounts in public Azure always use a common FQDN suffix. Override this endpoint suffix with a different suffix in certain circumstances (like Azure Stack or non-public Azure regions).

property.name: Credentials Service
property.description: Controller Service used to obtain Azure Storage Credentials.

property.name: Message Time To Live
property.description: Maximum time to allow the message to be in the queue

property.name: Visibility Timeout
property.description: The length of time during which the message will be invisible after it is read. If the processing unit fails to delete the message after it is read, then the message will reappear in the queue.

property.name: Request Timeout
property.description: The timeout for read or write requests to Azure Queue Storage. Defaults to 1 second.

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. Supported proxies: SOCKS, HTTP In case of SOCKS, it is not guaranteed that the selected SOCKS Version will be used by the processor.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: Unsuccessful operations will be transferred to the failure relationship.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: All successfully processed FlowFiles are routed to this relationship

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.services.azure.StandardAzureCredentialsControllerService
extension.description: Provide credentials to use with an Azure client.

allowableValue.description: Uses default credential chain. It first checks environment variables, before trying managed identity.
Azure Virtual Machine Managed Identity (it can only be used when NiFi is running on Azure)

property.name: managed-identity-client-id
property.description: Client ID of the managed identity. The property is required when User Assigned Managed Identity is used for authentication. It must be empty in case of System Assigned Managed Identity.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.services.azure.cosmos.document.AzureCosmosDBClientService
extension.description: Provides a controller service that configures a connection to Cosmos DB (Core SQL API) and provides access to that connection to other Cosmos DB-related components.

property.name: azure-cosmos-db-uri
property.description: Cosmos DB URI, typically in the form of https://{databaseaccount}.documents.azure.com:443/ Note this host URL is for Cosmos DB with Core SQL API from Azure Portal (Overview->URI)

property.name: azure-cosmos-db-key
property.description: Cosmos DB Access Key from Azure Portal (Settings->Keys). Choose a read-write key to enable database or container creation at run time

property.name: azure-cosmos-db-consistency-level
property.description: Choose from five consistency levels on the consistency spectrum. Refer to Cosmos DB documentation for their differences

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.services.azure.data.explorer.StandardKustoIngestService
extension.description: Sends batches of flowfile content or stream flowfile content to an Azure ADX cluster.

property.name: Authentication Strategy

allowableValue.description: Azure Application Registration with Application Key

property.name: Application Client ID

property.name: Application Key

property.name: Application Tenant ID
property.description: Azure Data Explorer Application Tenant Identifier for Authentication

property.name: Cluster URI

property.name: Cluster URI
